title: Basic Information
subtitle: Used for Census purposes as well.

questions.title: Name, Surname
questions.subtitle: Your name and surname should match the name on your ID.

questions.title: Nickname/Playa name
Which gender do you associate with?
Date of Birth
questions.subtitle: This event requires your date of birth for registration. The date given should match your government issued ID. Failure to provide your valid Date Of Birth may result in your entry to the event being denied.

questions.title: What is your Country of Residence?
How did come to know of this gathering? If someone invited you, tell us who.
Have you attended any burns?
How many years have you attended DeJā?
Do you suffer from any physical or mental health issues that you would like to make us aware about?
questions.subtitle: This is helpful in case something happens with you so that someone will know how to help you if the need arises.

questions.title: Will you be traveling with children?
questions.subtitle: If you plan to bring children age 16 or older, they will need to enroll like an adult. Any co-creator younger than 18 will have to be accompanied by a legal guardian.
questions.subtitleif: How many? Please list their names.

questions.title: Are you involved with a theme camp at DeJā?
What is your purpose in attending DeJā?
questions.subtitle: More than one answer is allowed.
answers: I am part of a theme camp

questions.title: Before having read the information on this site: Did you know that DeJā is a ticket-free event, meaning we do not sell tickets for entry to this gathering?
I am aware that nothing is sold and I will not sell anything at DeJā.
I understand that DeJā operates on a gifting economy, and I know the difference between gifting and bartering.

I am aware that I have to bring everything I plan to eat, drink or otherwise consume as well as take all the trash I make out of the property with me after the event and dispose of it in a proper designated receptacle.
I understand that the only thing provided for me is an outhouse and a place to camp.
I am aware that DeJā is not a festival.
I agree to observe the 12 guidelines which are refered to as the Code of the Republic?
answers: Yes, I have read and understand the Code of the Republic and will ensure that anyone I invite has read it and understands it as well.
No, I am too lazy to read and want to be publicly shamed.

questions.title: I am aware that this is a 5 day event and that I am encouraged to arrive as early as the 16th if setting up a large scale installation or theme camp.
answers: Yes and I will come before the event begins to help set up.
I promise to arrive as early as possible and help out as much as my schedule allows me to.

questions.title: I am also aware that I am encouraged to stay after the event to help with moop patrol/strike.
answers: Yes and I will stay until the end and help with tear down and moop sweeps.
I promise to stay as long as possible and help out as much as my schedule allows me to.

questions.title: I am willing to stay one extra day to help myself and fellow comrades with strike.
I am willing to unplug from social media and immerse myself in the event.

title: Don't let it hit the ground, but let the bodies hit the floor

questions.title: MOOP is short for:
I am ready to take responsibility for any trash or recyclables which I or anyone else around the site produced.
If need be, are you willing to leave space in your vehicle and take an orphan bag of trash when you leave the site?
I agree to not walk past any MOOP I may encounter and instead pick it up and dispose of it properly.
If you smoke, are you willing to carry a portable ashtray?
I understand there are no rubbish bins other than ones I provide for myself or my camp arranges.
Are you aware that at DeJā it is normal to see people dressed as unicorns, superheroes, in onesies or in nothing at all?
I understand that people will leave their body image issues (towards themselves and others) outside of the gate and most likely will show public displays of affection.
answers: I find that clothes limit my self-expression.
Fantastic!! makes packing so much easier.

questions.title: Are you prepared to exchange uncomfortably long hugs with random hippies?
answers: Ready?? I have been waiting for this all year.
Freaking fucking hippies and their uncomfortably long hugs. gross.
No, not really, but i am comfortable enough in my skin to say "no, thank you" if asked.

questions.title: Have you been informed that there will be some barely clothed and even naked bodies at DeJā?
questions.subtitle: Some pretty hot ones too?
answers: I am uncomforable with nudity, maybe i shouldn't go.
I am comfortable around naked people.
Unsure how i feel about this, but i am open minded.

questions.title: Will you resist your primal urges to grope everyone that looks good to you, and seek the person's consent BEFORE doing anything or otherwise risk overstepping your boundaries?
answers: I always ask for consent. Only yes means yes.
A slap on the hands means no.
Too impaired to answer means no.

questions.title: I agree to ask permission before taking anyone's picture, because not everyone at DeJā wants to be photographed.
answers: No, I skipped this section in the Survival Guide.

questions.title: I will seek consent from participants prior to posting any images on social media.

title: Participation
subtitle: DeJā is a co-creative and participant driven event. There are no spectators. There is no programme.

questions.title: Are you aware that being on the guest list commits you to co-create, to participate and to contribute to making this event an amazing experience?
answers: Yes, I have been planning for this all year.
I am not really sure what I can do, but i will keep an open mind and be willing to help out where ever i can.

questions.title: How will you be participating and what will you be sharing with the community?
Have you ever been escorted out of a burn?

title: Volunteering
subtitle: DeJā is built on co-creation and a community that takes care of each other. This event does not happen without your efforts to cooperate and volunteer. You do not need prior experience, and if this is your first DeJā, you are highly encouraged to participate! If you'd like to be part of one of the Ministries, please let us know by marking your preferred area(s) in the options below. Note that this is not binding, you only agree to be contacted with the option to participate.

questions.title: Which Ministry would you like to volunteer with?
questions.subtitle: You may pick more than one, but limit yourself to no more than 2 shift maximum per day. Please note: unless specified all of these positions require help during the event. (° This position requires your help before and/or after event) (°° This position requires your help after the event)
answers: Ministry of Public Works ° (pre-event/build) must be available to arrive on property between the 17th - 20th of June
Ministry of Public Works ° (strike, tear-down/clean-up) must be able to stay until the 25th of June
Ministry of Hazard (fire wood, fire safety, "rangers", first-aid, welfare, "mal-fare")
Ministry of Civic Responsibility ° (Volunteer and Information Hubs)
Ministry of Culture ° (Folklorist, Historian, Documentarian, Art Installations, Workshops)

questions.title: Have you considered donating financially to help with the cost of the infrastructure?
questions.subtitleif: How would you like your donation used?
answers: I plan on donating resources for the benefit of the community at the event.

questions.title: E-mail confirmation
questions.subtitle: Please confirm the e-mail you created your account on this site with – your entry approval will be sent to it and it will be used to connect you in the appropriate Slack channels.
